definitions.definition: A point or place where a check is performed, especially a point along a road or on a frontier where travellers are stopped for inspection

A situation, often represented by a point in time , at which the state of a database system is known to be valid , and to which it can be returned in the event of a crisis by using a combination of backups and logs ; the data stored at this event.
examples: After the crash, we rolled back the database to the last checkpoint .

definitions.definition: A predetermined point in a map, level or scenario that the player may resume from if they die or restart.
examples: You can't finish the race if you haven't passed all of the checkpoints on the track.

definitions.definition: A biological control mechanism ensuring correct progression through the cell cycle .

main_definition: A point or place where a check is performed, especially a point along a road or on a frontier where travellers are stopped for inspection
secondary_definitions: ( computing ) A situation, often represented by a point in time , at which the state of a database system is known to be valid , and to which it can be returned in the event of a crisis by using a combination of backups and logs ; the data stored at this event.
( video games ) A predetermined point in a map, level or scenario that the player may resume from if they die or restart.
( biology ) A biological control mechanism ensuring correct progression through the cell cycle .
